cs155.jray

Class RayTracer3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs155.jray.RayTracer3D

  • public class RayTracer3D
extends java.lang.Object
    This consists of static methods for drawing a scene on a canvas.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RayTracer3D()

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Color3D calcColorForLight(Ray3D r, Point3D n, Point3D p, Material m, Light3D light)
      Calculate the color of a pixel corresponding to a specified light.
      private static Ray3D calcReflectionRay(Ray3D r, RayHit h)
      calculate the ray r' that you obtain by reflecting the ray r off of the hitpoint h
      private static Color3D calculateDiffuse(Point3D n, Color3D matColor, Color3D lightColor, Point3D lightVec)
      calculate the diffuse color, by calculating the diffuse intensity and multiplying it by the diffuse material color and the diffuse lighting color
      private static Color3D calculateSpecular(Ray3D r, Point3D n, Point3D p, Color3D matSpecular, int matHardness, Color3D lightSpecular, Point3D lightVec)
      calculate the specular color, by calculating the specular intensity and multiplying it by the diffuse material color and the diffuse lighting color
      static Color3D computeColor(Ray3D r, Scene3D s, int depth)
      Compute the color of the pixel corresponding to the intersection of the ray r with the first object in the scene s
      static void drawScene(Scene3D s)
      draw a view of the scene on a canvas.
      private static boolean isObscured(Light3D light, Point3D point, Object3D obj, Group3D objs)
      return true if the ray starting at the point and heading toward the light hits an object on its way there, you'll need to be careful about the intersection of the point with the object it is on (with distance zero or close to zero!) that one shouldn't count as obscuring the light...
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

                 Point3D point,
                 Object3D obj,
                 Group3D objs)
        return true if the ray starting at the point and heading toward the light hits an object on its way there, you'll need to be careful about the intersection of the point with the object it is on (with distance zero or close to zero!) that one shouldn't count as obscuring the light...
        Parameters:

        point -
        objs -

      • calcColorForLight

        public static Color3D calcColorForLight(Ray3D r,
                        Point3D n,
                        Point3D p,
                        Material m,
                        Light3D light)
        Calculate the color of a pixel corresponding to a specified light. This method calculates the diffuse, specular, and ambient components of the lighting and adds them together to get the final result
        Parameters:
        r - the ray corresponding to the pixel
        n - the normal to the surface at the intersection point
        p - the point of where the ray intersects the object
        m - the material of the object
        light - the light being considered
        Returns:

      • calculateDiffuse

        private static Color3D calculateDiffuse(Point3D n,
                       Color3D matColor,
                       Color3D lightColor,
                       Point3D lightVec)
        calculate the diffuse color, by calculating the diffuse intensity and multiplying it by the diffuse material color and the diffuse lighting color
        Parameters:

        matColor -
        lightColor -
        lightVec -
        Returns:

      • calculateSpecular

        private static Color3D calculateSpecular(Ray3D r,
                        Point3D n,
                        Point3D p,
                        Color3D matSpecular,
                        int matHardness,
                        Color3D lightSpecular,
                        Point3D lightVec)
        calculate the specular color, by calculating the specular intensity and multiplying it by the diffuse material color and the diffuse lighting color
        Parameters:
        r - the ray from the camera (i.e. the eye)
        n - the normal
        p - the point of intersection
        matSpecular - the specular material color
        matHardness - the specular hardness coefficient
        lightSpecular - the specular color of the light
        lightVec - the vector pointing to the light
        Returns:

      • drawScene

        public static void drawScene(Scene3D s)
        draw a view of the scene on a canvas. The method should get the width and height of the film from the camera then it should loop through each pixel on the film and do the following - use the camera to generate a ray for that pixel - compute the color corresponding to that ray - draw that color to the corresponding pixel on the film

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
